    Validate the integrity of padloc-db

Validate the integrity of padloc-db

Leighton Payne

2023-02-02

Source: vignettes/validate_the_integrity_of_padloc-db.Rmd
validate_the_integrity_of_padloc-db.Rmd
library(padlocdev)

Reading padloc-db files 

# hmm_meta <- read_hmm_meta("")
# sys_meta <- read_sys_meta("")
# sys_groups <- read_sys_groups("")

Convenience wrappers are provided for reading all sys/*.yaml and hmm/*.hmm files into a list. For example, reading all of the HMMs in a directory:

# Reading the entirity of a padloc model into R 
# path <- padlocdev_example("hmm")
# hmm <- multi_read_hmm(path)

Reading a complete profile HMM into R

# Read header data for all HMMs in 
path <- padlocdev_example("hmm")
path
#> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/padlocdev/extdata/hmm
hmm <- multi_read_hmm_header(path)
hmm[1]
#> $PROT00001
#> $PROT00001$`HMMER3/f`
#> [1] "[3.3 | Nov 2019]"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$NAME
#> [1] "Protein_00001"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$LENG
#> [1] "5"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$ALPH
#> [1] "amino"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$ACC
#> [1] "PROT00001"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$DESC
#> [1] "This protein does something"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$MAXL
#> integer(0)
#> 
#> $PROT00001$RF
#> [1] "no"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$MM
#> [1] "no"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$CONS
#> [1] "yes"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$CS
#> [1] "no"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$MAP
#> [1] "yes"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$DATE
#> [1] "Thu Jan  7 16:11:08 2021"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$COM
#> integer(0)
#> 
#> $PROT00001$NSEQ
#> [1] "10"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$EFFN
#> [1] "0.825195"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$CKSUM
#> [1] "653067045"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$GA
#> integer(0)
#> 
#> $PROT00001$TC
#> integer(0)
#> 
#> $PROT00001$NC
#> integer(0)
#> 
#> $PROT00001$`STATS LOCAL MSV`
#> [1] "-11.9551  0.69676"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$`STATS LOCAL VITERBI`
#> [1] "-13.0895  0.69676"
#> 
#> $PROT00001$`STATS LOCAL FORWARD`
#> [1] "-6.4760  0.69676"

# Read all padloc models
path <- padlocdev_example("sys")
path
#> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/padlocdev/extdata/sys

sys <- multi_read_padloc_model(path)
sys[1]
#> [1] "SystemA_I"

Check that sys models are valid 

# do stuff
